ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course especially to students in the humanities who are interested in an introduction to social science methods and concepts. Ethnography seems like an ideal transition point between these two areas of study, and the material is generally accessible even to those without strong background knowledge.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I was pleasantly surprised by how this course helped shape my thinking. I am not an ethnographer or social scientist, and took this course primarily to meet a departmental requirement. But the discussions of the politics of representation, in particular, were consistently helpful and thought-provoking, and I ended up finding much it more applicable to my own work than I had anticipated. Professor Anderson also did a great job of creating a welcoming and warm environment. Thank you!
